lead_paragraph: The movement called Beirut, My City performed surprisingly well in municipal elections, emerging as an unlikely alternative to feudal political bosses.

headline.print_headline: Beirut Upstarts Find Footing in Political Quagmire
headline.main: Beirut Upstarts Gain Traction in Lebanon’s Political Quagmire

snippet: The movement called Beirut, My City performed surprisingly well in municipal elections, emerging as an unlikely alternative to feudal political bosses.
abstract: Beirut, My City, political party formed by Lebanese citizens, wins about 40 percent of vote in municipal elections, sending powerful message to political bosses who have sought to maintain control of country's politics; while rigid election laws prevent independent political parties from challenging sectarian factions at national level, municipal elections provide opening for those weary of ineffectual and corrupt government.
